image.caption: The Big Dipper over the Firehole River, Yellowstone NP, WY.
An overcast sky begins to break around the peaks of the Wind River Range, near Green River Lakes, WY.
Looking out atop Devils Bridge, near Sedona, AZ.

image.caption: This old homestead near Green River Lakes, WY, made for a spooky scene with a candle lantern and an overcast, moonlit sky.

image.caption: My brother and I posed for this Milky Way shot at 11,000 feet in Titcomb Basin, WY.
We caught a spectacular sunset over the Tetons at Schwabacher's Landing, within Grand Teton NP.

image.imageURL: images/09 String Lake Jon Bridge View to West Denoise.jpg

image.linkURL: images/09 String Lake Jon Bridge View to West Denoise.jpg

image.caption: The night sky and the peaks of the Tetons rise over a candlelit footbridge in Grand Teton NP, WY.
Yellowstone NP has some of the darkest skies in the country, and it shows in this shot on the shore of Yellowstone Lake.
The bacterial mats of Grand Prismatic Spring in Yellowstone NP are just as spectacular at nighttime, producing intricate patterns among mirror-like water.
While hiking in Glacier NP, MT, I noticed this sun-struck spiderweb and at first thought it was a CD suspended in midair!
Comet NEOWISE passed close to Earth in July 2020. Here it soars over the Wisconsin Capitol building and the skyline of Madison, WI.

image.imageURL: images/small cropHandies Sunrise West View IMG_8470-Pano_1 copy.jpg
image.thumbURL: thumbs/small cropHandies Sunrise West View IMG_8470-Pano_1 copy.jpg

image.caption: My dad and I got up very early in the morning to be atop Colorado 14er Handies Peak for sunrise.
Enjoying a chilly, windy sunrise from Handies Peak, CO.
I ponder a panorama of Colorado's San Jaun range, near the summit of 14er Wetterhorn Peak.
I straddle the wind-swept line between light and darkness on a dune in Great Sand Dunes NP, CO.
Looking across the 2,500 foot-deep chasm of the Black Canyon of the Gunnison, CO.
Trickling water forms massive "ice caves" in the deep winter of Michigan's Upper Peninsula, reflecting and refracting the rich light of a candle lantern.
Shooting the ice caves at night reminds one of exploring the Mines of Moria from Lord of the Rings.
In other places the freezing water constructs intricate ice cones, like portals to a subterranean world.
My dad and I perch above Hidden Lake in Glacier NP, MT.
The sprawling gorges and far-off mountains of Canyonlands NP, UT, beckons me to adventure.
Waterfalls snake down many mountainsides of Glacier NP, MT.

Illuminating the soaring spans of Double Arch in Arches NP with a headlamp.

Jagged peaks in the remote Cirque of the Towers, WY, reach for a flawless night sky.

image.caption: A candlelit journey through the dark winter forests and prairies of south-central WI.
Perfect conditions of a cloudless sky and glassy water at St. Mary's Lake, Glacier NP, just before a passing boat disrupted the tranquility.
Camping under the stars just outside of Yellowstone NP, WY.
